common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11 Performance Issues and Bugs
common_issues.description: Users report various issues after upgrading to Pieces OS 11, including slow performance, unresponsiveness in VSCode extension, and problems with LTM and Copilot modules. Suggested solutions include updating to the latest patch (11.0.1), checking log files, and switching to alternative models like OpenAI or Gemini. The Pieces team is actively working on addressing these issues and improving infrastructure.

Hey 👋,

We are experiencing some issues on and off w/ Claude Sonnet 3.5 within the Copilot Modules of all the applications.

If you are experiencing this issue please first:
1. change the Model runtime to OpenAI or Gemini as these are working very consistently.
2. Ensure you sign in to the Pieces Ecosystem, this will ensure that you have a larger rate limit than those users who are NOT authenticated.

Please feel free to comment in this thread if you are experiencing similar issues!

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation about LTM Engine activation

**Key Points:**

* User reported an issue with activating the Long-Term Memory Engine (LTM) after downloading a local LLM.
* Pieces support team acknowledged the issue and triaged it to the relevant team member.
* They provided helpful resources while waiting for a response.
* It was identified that the downloaded LLM’s state was overriding the saved selected model, preventing LTM activation.
* A fix was implemented and released in a patch on December 19th, 2024.

**Solutions:**

* Update PiecesOS and Desktop application to versions 11.0.1 and 3.3.1 respectively.
* Provide the Pieces team with log files for further investigation.

**Current Status:**

* The issue with LTM activation appears to be resolved for most users with the new update.
* However, one user continues to experience the problem and has provided additional logs and a video demonstrating the issue.

**Outcome:**

* The issue has been identified and a fix has been implemented.
* Additional investigation is required for the user still experiencing the problem.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues in VS Code
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from the VS Code extension, particularly within Docker containers and remote environments. This is often due to firewall restrictions, DNS resolution problems, or the extension's reliance on specific network configurations. Solutions include configuring firewalls, using custom URLs, and ensuring Pieces OS is running before launching VS Code in a container.

related_issues.title: Can't connect from dev container
related_issues.text: Can't connect from dev container ### Software Pieces OS, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 9.0.7 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. # Issue description Hi, Pieces OS is working fine in VSCode (extension version: `v1.16.2`), until I load into a dev container. VSCode gives me these notifications: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/48d644e3-c170-4caf-8258-d96f2323c2cf) ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/a393edaf-8405-4581-9807-3ae093d078e3) Pieces explorer looks like this: # Attempted fixes I tried to turn off / disable macOS native firewall as well as [Lulu](https://objective-see.org/products/lulu.html) completely, but the issue still persists. Not sure how to make inbound firewall rule for port 1000 on macOS, where you need to specify an exact application associated with firewall rules. # One strange behavior Now, one thing is strange - **if PiecesOS is turned off before opening VSCode and I open a VSCode in dev container straight away, PiecesOS automatically starts and shows me the welcome window**: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/07cd8e60-1b29-4757-8204-c82d87cd39ce) Does it mean, that the VSCode extension inside dev container (i.e. docker container) can communicate with host and startup the application? If so, why does it fail to communicate further? ## GitHub Issue Summary: Docker Container and Pieces Extension **Key points raised:** - The **Pieces extension in VS Code is unable to connect to Pieces OS running in a Docker container**. - This issue was due to the extension relying on the `host.docker.internal` DNS name to determine if Pieces OS is running. **Problems identified:** - **Pieces OS needs to be running before VS Code is launched** for the extension to function correctly in a Dev container. - The extension relies on a DNS name that is **not accessible in cloud-based remote development environments**. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** - Use a custom URL to directly access Pieces OS in the docker container (implemented as a temporary solution). - Allow users to specify multiple URLs to automatically try and connect to Pieces OS (proposed). - Improve support for cloud-based environments by adding port forwarding instructions and updating documentation. - Add a startup notification linking to documentation when a remote environment is detected. **Current status/outcome:** - The **temporary solution using a custom URL works**. - **Long-term solutions are being investigated**. - Documentation has been updated with instructions for cloud-based environments.
